alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 4:28AM CDT until June 17 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 AM CDT FOR SCOTT AND MORGAN COUNTIES... At 427 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Meredosia to 9 miles west of White Hall, moving east at 50 mph. Additional strong to severe storms were located between Jacksonville and Franklin, also moving east. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Chapin, Arenzville, Jacksonville, Literberry and Alexander. This includes Interstate 72 between mile markers 43 and 79. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
